title: Colossians Chapter 2 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Colossians chapter 2 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Colossians Chapter 2 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Colossians Chapter 2.

questions.question: According to Colossians 2:1, for whom does Paul have a great conflict?
options: You, them at Laodicea, and those who have not seen his face
questions.correctAnswer: You, them at Laodicea, and those who have not seen his face
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:1 states Paul has a great conflict for 'you, and for them at Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh.'

questions.question: What are the hearts of believers knit together in, according to Colossians 2:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Love
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:2 says that hearts are comforted and knit together in love.

questions.question: Where are all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge hidden, according to Colossians 2:3?
questions.correctAnswer: In Christ
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:3 clearly states that all treasures of wisdom and knowledge are hidden in Christ.

questions.question: Why does Paul warn the believers in Colossians 2:4?
options: Lest any man beguile them with enticing words
questions.correctAnswer: Lest any man beguile them with enticing words
questions.explanation: Paul warns in Colossians 2:4 not to be beguiled by enticing words.

questions.question: According to Colossians 2:6, how should believers walk?
options: As they have received Christ Jesus the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: As they have received Christ Jesus the Lord
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:6 instructs believers to walk in Christ as they have received Him.

questions.question: What are believers warned to beware of in Colossians 2:8?
questions.correctAnswer: Philosophy and vain deceit
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:8 warns believers to beware lest any man spoil them through philosophy and vain deceit.

questions.question: According to Colossians 2:9, in whom dwelleth all the fullness of the Godhead bodily?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:9 states that all the fullness of the Godhead dwells bodily in Christ.

questions.question: What does Colossians 2:10 say believers are in Christ?
questions.correctAnswer: Complete
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:10 explains believers are complete in Christ, who is the head of all principality and power.

questions.question: According to Colossians 2:12, what symbolizes being buried and risen with Christ?
questions.correctAnswer: Baptism
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:12 describes baptism as the act where believers are buried and risen with Christ through faith.

questions.question: True or False: According to Colossians 2:14, Christ nailed the handwriting of ordinances to the cross.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:14 tells us that the handwriting of ordinances against us was nailed to the cross by Christ.

questions.question: True or False: Colossians 2:16 says believers should be judged based on eating and drinking.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:16 instructs that no one should judge believers in meat or drink or holy days.

questions.question: True or False: Colossians 2:18 warns against worshipping angels and voluntary humility.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:18 warns believers not to be beguiled by worshipping angels or voluntary humility.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Colossians 2:7: 'Rooted and built up in him, and stablished in the faith, as ye have been taught, abounding therein with ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: thanksgiving
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:7 says believers should abound in thanksgiving as they are rooted and built up in Christ.

questions.question: According to Colossians 2:13, what has God done for those dead in sins?
options: Quickened them and forgiven all trespasses
questions.correctAnswer: Quickened them and forgiven all trespasses
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:13 states that God hath quickened those dead in sins and forgiven all trespasses.

questions.question: According to Colossians 2:21, which of the following is NOT one of the ordinances mentioned?
questions.correctAnswer: Pray not
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:21 lists 'Touch not; taste not; handle not,' but does not mention 'Pray not.'

medium.title: Colossians Chapter 2 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Colossians Chapter 2 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubt and fear. Based on Colossians 2, what biblical truth would you share about remaining steadfast in faith?
options: Walk in Christ as you received Him, rooted and built up in faith
Rely on human philosophy and traditions for strength
Judge others by their observance of holy days
Avoid worshipping angels to maintain humility
questions.correctAnswer: Walk in Christ as you received Him, rooted and built up in faith
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:6-7 encourages believers to walk in Christ, being rooted and built up in Him and established in faith. This strengthens steadfastness and thanksgiving amid trials.

questions.question: How does Colossians 2 warn believers about the influence of worldly philosophies and deceit?
options: Beware lest any spoil you through philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men
Embrace all teachings to gain full understanding
Ignore teachings that contradict cultural norms
Focus only on external religious rituals
questions.correctAnswer: Beware lest any spoil you through philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:8 warns believers to be cautious of deceptive philosophy based on human tradition and worldly rudiments rather than Christ, emphasizing discernment in spiritual matters.

questions.question: What assurance does Colossians 2 give about Christ's nature and the believer's completeness in Him?
options: All the fullness of the Godhead dwells bodily in Christ, and believers are complete in Him
Christ is a great teacher but not divine
Believers must add traditions to be complete
Completeness comes from observing holy days
questions.correctAnswer: All the fullness of the Godhead dwells bodily in Christ, and believers are complete in Him
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:9-10 states that all the fullness of God dwells in Christ bodily and that believers are made complete in Him, who is the head over every power.

questions.question: A new believer asks about the significance of baptism. Based on Colossians 2, how would you explain it?
options: Baptism symbolizes being buried and risen with Christ through faith in God's power
Baptism is a ritual to earn salvation
Baptism is only a tradition with no spiritual meaning
Baptism must be repeated to maintain forgiveness
questions.correctAnswer: Baptism symbolizes being buried and risen with Christ through faith in God's power
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:12 explains that baptism represents burial with Christ and rising through faith in the working of God who raised Him from the dead, signifying new life.

questions.question: How does Colossians 2 teach about forgiveness and spiritual renewal?
options: God has forgiven all trespasses and quickened believers together with Christ
Forgiveness is earned by following commandments
Forgiveness requires strict observance of festivals
Forgiveness is limited to those circumcised by human hands
questions.correctAnswer: God has forgiven all trespasses and quickened believers together with Christ
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:13 teaches that though we were dead in sins, God has made us alive with Christ and forgiven all our trespasses, highlighting spiritual renewal through grace.

questions.question: What does Colossians 2 say about the old written laws and ordinances?
options: God blotted out the handwriting of ordinances against us, nailing it to the cross
The old laws remain binding for all believers
Observing the law is essential for salvation
The laws should be followed to avoid judgment
questions.correctAnswer: God blotted out the handwriting of ordinances against us, nailing it to the cross
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:14 explains that Christ canceled the written code of ordinances that stood against us by nailing it to His cross, signifying freedom from the law's condemnation.

questions.question: According to Colossians 2, what victory did Christ achieve over spiritual powers?
options: He spoiled principalities and powers, making a public spectacle of them
He allowed them to judge believers
questions.correctAnswer: He spoiled principalities and powers, making a public spectacle of them
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:15 describes how Christ triumphed over spiritual rulers and authorities, publicly disarming them through His cross.

questions.question: A believer is being judged for their dietary choices and observance of special days. What guidance does Colossians 2 offer?
options: Do not let anyone judge you about food, drink, or holy days, as these are shadows of things to come
Strictly follow all dietary laws and festivals to be accepted
Avoid fellowship with those who do not observe holy days
Focus only on external rituals for spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: Do not let anyone judge you about food, drink, or holy days, as these are shadows of things to come
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:16-17 teaches that believers should not be judged by others regarding food, drink, or festival observances, since these are shadows pointing to Christ, who is the substance.

questions.question: True or False: Colossians 2 warns against worshipping angels and practicing voluntary humility.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:18 cautions believers not to be deceived into worshipping angels or practicing false humility, which come from fleshly pride rather than Christ.

questions.question: How does Colossians 2 describe the relationship of believers to Christ as the Head?
options: All the body grows and is nourished from the Head, Christ
Believers are independent of Christ's leadership
The body is disconnected from the Head
Only a few believers are connected to Christ
questions.correctAnswer: All the body grows and is nourished from the Head, Christ
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:19 explains that Christ is the Head, from whom the whole body grows and is nourished, emphasizing unity and dependence on Him.

questions.question: A believer wants to know why some old religious rules seem unnecessary now. How does Colossians 2 explain this?
options: They are worldly rudiments that perish with use and are commandments of men
They are eternal and must be strictly followed
They are the only way to gain favor with God
They provide the true wisdom that saves
questions.correctAnswer: They are worldly rudiments that perish with use and are commandments of men
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:20-22 shows that the old rules (touch not, taste not, handle not) are earthly commandments and doctrines that are destined to perish and do not bring true spiritual life.

questions.question: True or False: According to Colossians 2, religious rules that appear wise because of humility and worship satisfy the flesh.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:23 states that such rules have the appearance of wisdom but do not honor the flesh or satisfy it, highlighting the emptiness of legalistic practices.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Colossians 2 teaches that believers are _______ in Christ, who is the head of all principality and power.
questions.correctAnswer: complete
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:10 states believers are complete in Christ, who holds authority over every principality and power, affirming spiritual fullness in Him.

questions.question: How does Colossians 2 encourage believers to support one another amid spiritual conflict?
options: By being knit together in love and comforted with full assurance of understanding
By isolating themselves to avoid deception
By judging those who differ in belief
questions.correctAnswer: By being knit together in love and comforted with full assurance of understanding
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:2 teaches that believers should be united in love and comforted with full assurance in understanding the mystery of God, promoting fellowship and encouragement.

questions.question: What does Paul say about his presence with the Colossians despite being absent physically?
options: He is with them in spirit, joying and seeing their faith and order
He is unaware of their condition
He only cares about their rituals
He expects them to write often
questions.correctAnswer: He is with them in spirit, joying and seeing their faith and order
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:5 reveals Paul’s spiritual presence with believers, rejoicing in their faith and orderly conduct despite physical absence.

hard.title: Colossians Chapter 2 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Colossians Chapter 2.

questions.question: In Colossians 2, what is described as being 'hid' in Christ, emphasizing the depth of divine wisdom and knowledge?
options: All the treasures of wisdom and knowledge
The mysteries of the kingdom of Israel
The prophecies of the Old Testament
questions.correctAnswer: All the treasures of wisdom and knowledge
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:3 states that in Christ are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge, highlighting the fullness of divine revelation in Him.

questions.question: The 'circumcision made without hands' mentioned in Colossians 2:11 is a typology of what spiritual reality?
options: Putting off the body of the sins of the flesh by the circumcision of Christ
Physical circumcision as practiced by Jews
The law given to Moses on Mount Sinai
The ritual cleansing of the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: Putting off the body of the sins of the flesh by the circumcision of Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 11 uses circumcision 'made without hands' as a metaphor for the spiritual removal of sinful nature through Christ's work.

questions.question: How does Paul describe the fullness of the Godhead in relation to Christ in Colossians 2?
options: All the fullness of the Godhead bodily dwells in Christ
The fullness is distributed among the apostles
Godhead is partially present in the law
It dwells only in the Father
questions.correctAnswer: All the fullness of the Godhead bodily dwells in Christ
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:9 clearly states that in Christ dwells all the fullness of the Godhead bodily, affirming His divine nature.

questions.question: What warning does Paul give concerning philosophy and vain deceit in Colossians 2:8?
options: Beware lest any man spoil you through philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men
Embrace all philosophies as they lead to understanding
Only Jewish traditions should be followed
Philosophy is the foundation of faith
questions.correctAnswer: Beware lest any man spoil you through philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men
questions.explanation: Paul warns against being led astray by human traditions and worldly rudiments rather than Christ (Colossians 2:8).

questions.question: According to Colossians 2:12, what is the significance of baptism in relation to Christ's death and resurrection?
options: Buried with Him in baptism and risen through faith in God's power
A ritual cleansing without spiritual meaning
A symbol of entry into the Jewish community
A tradition passed down from the apostles
questions.correctAnswer: Buried with Him in baptism and risen through faith in God's power
questions.explanation: Verse 12 explains baptism as a symbolic burial and resurrection with Christ through faith in God's operation.

questions.question: What does Paul say was 'blotted out' and 'nailed to the cross' in Colossians 2:14, symbolizing Christ's victory over the law’s demands?
options: The handwriting of ordinances that was against us
questions.correctAnswer: The handwriting of ordinances that was against us
questions.explanation: Paul describes how Christ removed the legal demands opposing believers by nailing them to the cross (Colossians 2:14).

questions.question: In what way does Colossians 2:15 depict Christ’s triumph over spiritual powers?
options: By spoiling principalities and powers, making a public show of them
By following the laws of the world
questions.correctAnswer: By spoiling principalities and powers, making a public show of them
questions.explanation: Verse 15 illustrates Christ’s victory by openly defeating and exposing spiritual principalities and powers.

questions.question: According to Colossians 2:16-17, why should believers not be judged over dietary laws or festivals?
options: Because these are shadows of things to come, but the body is of Christ
Because they are essential for salvation
Because they are new commands from the apostles
Because they are the foundation of Christian life
questions.correctAnswer: Because these are shadows of things to come, but the body is of Christ
questions.explanation: Paul explains that ceremonial laws are only shadows pointing to Christ, who is the substance (Colossians 2:16-17).

questions.question: What false practice involving angels does Paul warn against in Colossians 2:18?
options: Voluntary humility and worshipping of angels
questions.correctAnswer: Voluntary humility and worshipping of angels
questions.explanation: Verse 18 cautions believers not to be deceived by those who promote worship of angels as a spiritual practice.

questions.question: What metaphor does Paul use in Colossians 2:19 to describe the church’s relationship to Christ?
options: Christ as the Head from whom the body grows
Christ as a judge on a throne
questions.correctAnswer: Christ as the Head from whom the body grows
questions.explanation: Paul uses the metaphor of Christ as the Head, nourishing and uniting the body, which is the church (Colossians 2:19).

questions.question: What is the relationship between the 'rudiments of the world' and the believers according to Colossians 2:20?
options: Believers are dead with Christ to the rudiments but should not be subject to worldly ordinances
Rudiments are the foundation of faith
Rudiments are irrelevant to Christian life
questions.correctAnswer: Believers are dead with Christ to the rudiments but should not be subject to worldly ordinances
questions.explanation: Paul reminds believers that having died with Christ, they should not submit to worldly religious rules (Colossians 2:20).

questions.question: True or False: According to Colossians 2:5, Paul is physically present with the Colossians but absent in spirit.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Paul says he is absent in the flesh but present in spirit, rejoicing at their faith (Colossians 2:5).

questions.question: Which of the following best captures the admonition in Colossians 2:23 regarding certain religious practices?
options: They have a show of wisdom but do not satisfy the flesh
questions.correctAnswer: They have a show of wisdom but do not satisfy the flesh
questions.explanation: Verse 23 states these practices have an appearance of wisdom but do not truly honor the flesh or spiritual life.

questions.question: According to Colossians 2:7, how should believers be 'rooted and built up' in Christ?
options: Established in faith, abounding with thanksgiving
By following the Jewish law strictly
questions.correctAnswer: Established in faith, abounding with thanksgiving
questions.explanation: Paul instructs believers to be firmly rooted and built up in Christ, continuing in faith and thanksgiving (Colossians 2:7).

questions.question: What is the purpose of Paul’s great conflict mentioned in Colossians 2:1?
options: For the spiritual well-being of the Colossians and those in Laodicea
questions.correctAnswer: For the spiritual well-being of the Colossians and those in Laodicea
questions.explanation: Paul expresses concern for believers in Colossae and Laodicea, wanting them to have full understanding and faith (Colossians 2:1-2).

theological.title: Colossians Chapter 2 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Colossians Chapter 2 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Colossians 2:3, where are all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge hidden?
questions.correctAnswer: In Christ
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:3 states that all treasures of wisdom and knowledge are hidden in Christ. This aligns with Proverbs 2:6 where wisdom comes from God, and with John 1:14 which shows Christ as the Word full of grace and truth.

questions.question: What is Paul’s reason for writing to the Colossians about their faith according to Colossians 2:6-7?
options: So they might be rooted and built up in Christ
So they might follow the law strictly
So they might separate from the world
questions.correctAnswer: So they might be rooted and built up in Christ
questions.explanation: In verses 6-7, Paul urges believers to walk in Christ, being rooted and built up in Him, established in faith and abounding with thanksgiving. This corresponds with Ephesians 3:17 and Psalm 1:3, emphasizing spiritual growth in God.

questions.question: What does Paul warn the Colossians to beware of in Colossians 2:8?
questions.correctAnswer: Philosophy and vain deceit
questions.explanation: Paul warns in Colossians 2:8 against being spoiled through philosophy and vain deceit, which come from human traditions and worldly principles, not Christ. This is consistent with 1 Timothy 6:20 and 2 Corinthians 11:3.

questions.question: How does Colossians 2:9 describe the nature of Christ?
options: All the fullness of the Godhead bodily dwells in Him
questions.correctAnswer: All the fullness of the Godhead bodily dwells in Him
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:9 teaches the full deity of Christ, stating all the fullness of God dwells bodily in Him. This matches John 1:1-14 and Hebrews 1:3, affirming Christ’s divine nature.

questions.question: According to Colossians 2:10, believers are complete in whom?
options: Christ, the head of all principality and power
questions.correctAnswer: Christ, the head of all principality and power
questions.explanation: Verse 10 declares believers are complete in Christ, who is the head over all rule and authority. This is echoed in Ephesians 1:22-23 and Philippians 2:9-11.

questions.question: What spiritual act does Paul associate with being buried and risen with Christ in Colossians 2:12?
questions.correctAnswer: Baptism
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:12 links baptism to being buried and raised with Christ through faith in God’s power. This reflects Romans 6:3-4 and Acts 2:38 concerning the symbolism of baptism.

questions.question: What does Colossians 2:14 say Christ did with the handwriting of ordinances that was against us?
options: Blotted it out and nailed it to the cross
Changed it to a new law
questions.correctAnswer: Blotted it out and nailed it to the cross
questions.explanation: Verse 14 states Christ erased the record of charges against us and nailed it to the cross, signifying forgiveness of sins. This aligns with Hebrews 10:16-18 and Isaiah 53:5-6.

questions.question: What is the significance of Christ spoiling principalities and powers as described in Colossians 2:15?
questions.correctAnswer: He triumphed over them openly
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:15 describes Christ’s victory over spiritual powers, publicly displaying His triumph. This theme is also found in Ephesians 6:12 and 1 John 3:8.

questions.question: According to Colossians 2:16, in what areas should no one judge believers?
options: Meat, drink, holy days, new moons, or sabbaths
questions.correctAnswer: Meat, drink, holy days, new moons, or sabbaths
questions.explanation: Verse 16 forbids judging believers on dietary or ceremonial observances, emphasizing freedom in Christ. This is consistent with Romans 14:1-6 and Galatians 4:10-11.

questions.question: What does Colossians 2:17 say these religious observances are a shadow of?
questions.correctAnswer: The body is of Christ
questions.explanation: Colossians 2:17 explains that religious observances are shadows pointing to the reality found in Christ. Hebrews 10:1 similarly describes the law as a shadow of good things to come.

questions.question: What false practice does Paul warn against in Colossians 2:18?
options: Voluntary humility and worshipping of angels
questions.correctAnswer: Voluntary humility and worshipping of angels
questions.explanation: Verse 18 warns against false humility and angel worship, which distract from Christ as Head. This aligns with 2 Corinthians 11:14-15 and Revelation 19:10 emphasizing worship belongs only to God.

questions.question: How does Colossians 2:20 describe the believer’s relationship to the rudiments of the world after dying with Christ?
options: They should not be subject to worldly ordinances
They should keep the world’s customs
They should blend with the world
They should avoid all social contact
questions.correctAnswer: They should not be subject to worldly ordinances
questions.explanation: Paul asks why believers submit to worldly rules when they are dead with Christ to these rudiments, indicating freedom from legalistic observance, consistent with Galatians 5:1 and Romans 6:6.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a commandment or doctrine of men in Colossians 2:21-22?
questions.correctAnswer: Pray often
questions.explanation: Verses 21-22 list 'Touch not; taste not; handle not' as man-made commands, but do not mention prayer. This matches Jesus’ critique of human traditions in Mark 7:8-9.

questions.question: What does Paul say about commandments and doctrines of men in Colossians 2:23?
options: They have the appearance of wisdom but lack true value
questions.correctAnswer: They have the appearance of wisdom but lack true value
questions.explanation: Verse 23 describes these human rules as seeming wise in self-imposed worship and humility but not honoring the flesh. This is consistent with Matthew 15:9 and Titus 1:14.

questions.question: What does Colossians 2:11 say about the circumcision believers undergo?
options: It is a circumcision made without hands, by Christ
It is a Jewish rite only
questions.correctAnswer: It is a circumcision made without hands, by Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 11 teaches believers receive a spiritual circumcision by Christ, symbolizing putting off sinful flesh, which aligns with Romans 2:29 and Philippians 3:3.
